title: Finding a Niche in the U.S. Was Hard. Then She Found a Career Path.
text:
Vivinasviyanty Polanco was just 17 when her mother died of a heart attack. Her father died five years later , when she was in college.

An only child, Ms. Polanco had nothing keeping her in Jakarta, the capital of her native Indonesia, and decided it was time for “a new start in a new place.”

That place was the United States, where she had studied English as a high school exchange student in California. She had been dazzled by the spectacle of Disneyland there, and by Times Square on her first visit to New York City. More pragmatically, she viewed it as a dynamic country where hard work was rewarded and upward mobility was possible. She arrived in 2007 on a tourist visa and settled in Elmhurst, Queens.

When her father died, Ms. Polanco, now 40 , was studying economics, a major he had encouraged her to pursue. He wanted her to be independent and to make a better life for herself, she said.
description: Vivinasviyanty Polanco moved to the United States for a fresh start. After her daughter was born, a job training program helped her discover fulfillment and financial security.
